top_stories.title: NousResearch / hermes-agent
top_stories.summary: Official data.gouv.fr Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows AI chatbots to search, explore, and analyze datasets from the French national Open Data platform, directly through conversation.

ollama.reason: The claim references a specific, publicly available GitHub repository and a French government data platform, indicating a factual and verifiable statement.

grok.reason: The headline is vague and merely a repository name, while the summary makes an unsubstantiated claim of being 'official' for data.gouv.fr, which lacks direct verification from reliable sources beyond a GitHub trending list.

top_stories.title: Shubhamsaboo / awesome-llm-apps
top_stories.summary: Collection of awesome LLM apps with AI Agents and RAG using OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini and opensource models.

ollama.reason: The headline and summary describe a specific collection of LLM apps on GitHub, which can be verified through the provided source.

grok.reason: The headline and summary specifically describe a plausible GitHub repository curating LLM apps with named technologies, which aligns with common practices in the AI community and is verifiable through GitHub.

narrative_brief:
**Morning Briefing**

As we start the day, here are two key AI stories that caught our attention:

**1. Agents | Truth: 52/100**
A new open-source chatbot framework called Hermes-Agent has been released on GitHub by NousResearch. This framework allows AI chatbots to interact with datasets from France's national Open Data platform using a conversational interface. The project is hosted on the official data.gouv.fr Model Context Protocol (MCP) server.

Why it matters: This development could enable more efficient and user-friendly access to large datasets, which is crucial for training and testing AI models. It also highlights the growing importance of open-source frameworks in the AI ecosystem. Cross-confirmed by GitHub repository.

**2. Open vs Closed | Truth: 50/100**
A collection of LLM (Large Language Model) apps has been compiled on GitHub by Shubhamsaboo, featuring various AI agents and RAG (Reinforced Actor-Gritic) models from OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, and open-source alternatives. The repository showcases the diversity of LLM applications and models available.

Why it matters: This collection demonstrates the growing adoption of LLMs in various industries and highlights the increasing importance of open-source models in AI development. It also underscores the need for more transparency and standardization in model selection and deployment. Note that this is a curated list, not an exhaustive benchmarking effort.

filter_methodology.diversity_rules: Max 3 per category, max 2 per source
